page.title: 16FLORA AND FAUNA OF AREA
page.content: {Flora:-}Heather, bracken, bramble, bilberry, mountain ash or rowan tree prevail on the common land. Scots Pine, and more recently the Corsican Pine, are planted in the high forest area (1200 to an acre). Chestnuts, beech, sycamore, oak and other deciduous trees are grown and produce timber for fencing, rafters and building construction. { {Fauna:-}Wild deer - roe deer - live in the woodland and on the commons. They have to be periodically culled for numbers to be regulated. Rabbits are becoming very prolific. Squirrels can be a nuisance in chewing and damaging trees. The foresters like foxes and badgers. Partridges and pheasants are reared. Toads and frogs, some adders, grass snakes and sloe worms are all to be found in the forest areas.
